intro: Geonoma acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered geonoma, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes ferns and their allies. This plant is characterized by its delicate, strap-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Geonoma acutiflora produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or in the undergrowth of dense forests.
